p: Inflammation plays a role in the insurgence of various diseases and recent findings have suggested that an altered gut microbiota, in particular a reduction of health-promoting gut bacteria such as Lactobacilli and Bifidobacteria, has been linked to metabolic diseases, including obesity, diabetes, cardiovascular diseases [ 33], cystic fibrosis [ 34], neurological diseases (Parkinson’s disease, Alzheimer’s disease, and multiple sclerosis) [ 35], as well as musculoskeletal conditions such as frailty, osteoporosis, and gout [ 36, 37].
